metadata.title: CVE-2018-17937 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
gpsd versions 2.90 to 3.17 and microjson versions 1.0 to 1.3, an opensource project, allow a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code on embedded platforms via traffic onPort 2947/TCP or crafted JSON inputs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpsd - 3.17-6
gpsd-clients - 3.17-6
gpsd-tools - 3.17-6
libgps28 - 3.17-6
libqgpsmm28 - 3.17-6
python3-gps - 3.17-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpsd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.17-6').
